title: Distance Learner Food Pantries  · Angelo State University
description: Explore Angelo State’s Ram Pantry for Dual Credit students, providing food resources to support your success and well-being on campus.

paragraphs: To assist ASU students who are not on campus, we have put together a list of recommended resources where ASU students who face food insecurity may find community resources.

All food pantries/food banks have a website for more information about distributions schedules, location, and contact information. We advise you tocall firstbefore visiting the location to get their most updated information and to request eligibility information.
Click on the drop-down menus to find a food pantry/bank near you:
Food Bank of West Central Texas
Address: 5505 N 1st St, Abilene, TX 79603

The Food Bank of Abilene, Inc. The Food Bank of West Central Texas is a non-profit 501 (C) 3 community service organization that collects donated food to distribute to other non-profit agencies serving the needy of the Big Country.
United Methodist Service Center & Food Pantry
Address: 2618 N 1st St, Abilene, TX 79603

We currently operate two programs: The Food Pantry and the Service Center. The mission of the Food Pantry is to provide a week’s worth of nutritional groceries once every calendar month for economically disadvantaged families in Taylor County.
Christian Ministries - Highland Church of Christ
Address: 701 Walnut Street Abilene, TX 79601
Provides a food pantry. Documentation Required: Valid ID and Social Security Card(s)
Andrews Food Bank
Address: 711 NE 5th St, Andrews, TX 79714
At the West Texas Food Bank, our mission is to feed the hungry. If you need food assistance, you can start by requesting information about the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP).
Texas Health and Human Services
Address: 2017 Hutchins Ave, Ballinger, TX 76821

HHS offers help with food, health care and cash assistance for Texans. Find out if you are eligible by applying through yourtexasbenefits.com. Whether it’s Medicaid, SNAP food benefits or Temporary Assistance for Needy Families cash assistance, HHS is helping Texas families get back on their feet.
Rust Street Ministries
Address: 803 Rust St. San Angelo, TX 76903

Rust Street Ministries is a community outreach ministry located in San Angelo, Texas. We provide help with basic needs and life skills at no charge to those living in the Concho Valley area. Our programs are designed to serve the emotional and physical needs of our community by providing temporary assistance with food, clothing, household items and furniture.
First Baptist Church
Address: 1103 17th St, Brady, TX 76825

The Food Pantry distributes food to people in need on the second Friday morning of each month from 9:00-12:00. On food distribution mornings, ministry team members handle the paperwork, pray with the recipients individually, bag and box the food, and carry it to the recipients’ vehicle. In a typical month we serve over 100 families, with each family receiving around 30 lbs of food, plus an extra smaller box if there are children in the home.
Texas Health and Human Services
Address: 214 Lynn Gavit, Brady, TX 76825

HHS offers help with food, health care and cash assistance for Texans. Find out if you are eligible by applying through yourtexasbenefits.com. Whether it’s Medicaid, SNAP food benefits or Temporary Assistance for Needy Families cash assistance, HHS is helping Texas families get back on their feet.
Location 12 Miles Away
First United Methodist Church of Robert Lee
Address: 22 W 9th Street Robert Lee, TX 76945
Focus on Hunger Relief, Small Groups, Children and Childcare, Jobs and Careers, and Recreation and Health.
Locations 33 Miles Away
Ram Pantry - Angelo State
Address: 1910 Rosemont Dr San Angelo, TX 76901

Angelo State University promotes healthy living by providing immediate food needs for its students on campus. Located in the University Center in the Multicultural Center, Room 114 C, the Ram Pantry offers free essential non-perishable food items and toiletries for ASU students facing food insecurity and in need of essential hygiene products. This service is available to any currently enrolled ASU student who may be facing a difficult financial time and needs the assistance.
Concho Valley Regional Food Bank
Address: 1313 S. Hill St. San Angelo, Texas 76902

The Food Bank does not distribute food directly to individuals. Any 501 (C)-3 non-profit agency with a food program or planning to start a food program is eligible. Application packets may be obtained by calling 655-3231.Counties covered:Coke, Concho, Crockett, Irion, Kimble, McCulloch, Menard, Reagan, Schleicher, Sterling, Sutton and Tom Green.
Rust Street Ministries
Address: 803 Rust St. San Angelo, TX 76903

Rust Street Ministries is a community outreach ministry located in San Angelo, Texas. We provide help with basic needs and life skills at no charge to those living in the Concho Valley area. Our programs are designed to serve the emotional and physical needs of our community by providing temporary assistance with food, clothing, household items and furniture.
Locations 39 Miles Away
South Plains Food Bank
Address:5605 M.L.K. Jr Blvd, Lubbock, TX 79404

The South Plains Food Bank, inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to serving West Texas by providing those who experience food insecurity with a helping hand. The South Plains Food Bank, inc. also extends opportunities for community members to both engage in service, as well as for employment within an environment that promotes community interaction and is enthusiastic about aiding the conclusion of the poverty cycle.
LACare Food Bank
Address: 507 Buchanan Dr, Burnet, TX 78611

Lakes Area Care, Inc. (LACare) is an ecumenical, nonprofit organization providing food for individuals and families residing in the Burnet Consolidated Independent School District. LACare offers nutrition classes and serves as a referral clearinghouse for other services and resources located in the community.
Vanderveer St. Church of Christ- Community Kitchen
Address: 102 Vanderveer, Burnet, TX 78611
There is a free meal on Thursdays from 4:00-5:30pm at the Fellowship Building. We serve the 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month.

We can’t seem to locate a Food Pantry or Food Bank in this location. Do you know a food source for the public located here or in a near by city? Please email us atmulticultural@angelo.eduwith information.
First United Methodist Church of Crane
Address: 102 Frances St, Crane, TX 79731

We are serious about sharing God’s blessings with our community. Each 2nd and 4th Saturday of the month we serve from 10:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. we open our Community Food Pantry (CFP). Partnering with the West Texas Food Bank in Odessa, and with the help of volunteers from our church and community we provide food assistance for residents of our community who qualify (proof of residency and a signed statement of income is required).
Freedom Fellowship Church
Address: 1040 Early Blvd, Early, TX 76802
We offer free groceries to all who come, no questions asked. This is for Food Giveaway events only. Please check website for details.
Early Church of Christ
Address: 900 Early Blvd, Early, TX 76802
You’ll find many areas in which you can serve others in our community, show compassion, and share moments of grace in the lives of others. A food pantry is available for families in need.
Locations 32 Miles Away
First Baptist Church
Address: 1103 17th St, Brady, TX 76825

The Food Pantry distributes food to people in need on the second Friday morning of each month from 9-11 a.m.. On food distribution mornings, ministry team members handle the paperwork, pray with the recipients individually, bag and box the food, and carry it to the recipients’ cars. In a typical month we serve over 100 families, with each family receiving around 30 lbs of food, plus an extra smaller box if there are children in the home.
Texas Health and Human Services
Address: 214 Lynn Gavit, Brady, TX 76825

HHS offers help with food, health care and cash assistance for Texans. Find out if you are eligible by applying through yourtexasbenefits.com. Whether it’s Medicaid, SNAP food benefits or Temporary Assistance for Needy Families cash assistance, HHS is helping Texas families get back on their feet.
Locations 44 Miles Away
Ram Pantry - Angelo State
Address: 1910 Rosemont Dr San Angelo, TX 76901

Angelo State University promotes healthy living by providing immediate food needs for its students on campus. Located in the University Center in the Multicultural Center, Room 114 C, the Ram Pantry offers free essential non-perishable food items and toiletries for ASU students facing food insecurity and in need of essential hygiene products. This service is available to any currently enrolled ASU student who may be facing a difficult financial time and needs the assistance.
Concho Valley Regional Food Bank
Address: 1313 S. Hill St. San Angelo, Texas 76902

The Food Bank does not distribute food directly to individuals. Any 501 (C)-3 non-profit agency with a food program or planning to start a food program is eligible. Application packets may be obtained by calling 655-3231.Counties covered: Coke, Concho, Crockett, Irion, Kimble, McCulloch, Menard, Reagan, Schleicher, Sterling, Sutton and Tom Green.
Rust Street Ministries
Address: 803 Rust St. San Angelo, TX 76903

Rust Street Ministries is a community outreach ministry located in San Angelo, Texas. We provide help with basic needs and life skills at no charge to those living in the Concho Valley area. Our programs are designed to serve the emotional and physical needs of our community by providing temporary assistance with food, clothing, household items and furniture.
The Fredericksburg Food Pantry
Address: 701 Mustang St, Fredericksburg, TX 78624

The mission of the Fredericksburg Food Pantry is to provide a cooperative ministry of assistance to those in crisis situations by serving as a source of referral to other public and private agencies, to refer counseling, and to provide direct assistance through distribution of food to enable those who are in need to move toward relative independence. We serve as an extension of the ministry of participating congregations exclusively for charitable purposes. Days and hours of operation are Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays from 1pm until 5pm.
Papa’s Food Pantry of Somervell County
Address: 753 East Gibbs Boulevard, Glen Rose, Texas 76043

Papa’s Pantry is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization whose mission is to feed the hungry of Somervell County. The Food Bank is for Somervell County residents that are in need of food assistance. Clients must establish proof of residency by showing their current utility bill or rent receipt and a picture ID. Food assistance is available to only one party at a given address.
Mobile Food Pantry
Address: Varies
The Mobile Food Pantry often stops in this location. Please follow the link and open the Mobile Pantry Schedule and find this location.
Locations 19 Miles Away
Ram Pantry - Angelo State
Address: 1910 Rosemont Dr San Angelo, TX 76901

Angelo State University promotes healthy living by providing immediate food needs for its students on campus. Located in the University Center in the Multicultural Center, Room 114 C, the Ram Pantry offers free essential non-perishable food items and toiletries for ASU students facing food insecurity and in need of essential hygiene products. This service is available to any currently enrolled ASU student who may be facing a difficult financial time and needs the assistance.

Address: 1313 S. Hill St. San Angelo, Texas 76902

Application packets may be obtained by calling 655-3231. Counties covered: Coke, Concho, Crockett, Irion, Kimble, McCulloch, Menard, Reagan, Schleicher, Sterling, Sutton and Tom Green.

Our programs are designed to serve the emotional and physical needs of our community by providing temporary assistance with food, clothing, household items and furniture.

We can’t seem to locate a Food Pantry or Food Bank in this location. Do you know a food source for the public located here or in a near by city? Please email us atmulticultural@angelo.eduwith information.

We can’t seem to locate a Food Pantry or Food Bank in this location. Do you know a food source for the public located here or in a near by city? Please email us atmulticultural@angelo.eduwith information.
College St. Church of Christ
Address: 815 College St. Junction, TX 76849

Wednesday Night Meals: Every Wednesday during the school year we come together starting at 6:00 pm to eat a wonderful meal prepared by one of our members and fellowship together before Bible class. Everyone is invited to join and participate with us. Other services are offered.
Northside Church of Christ
Address: Junction, TX 76849
Food Bank & Ministerial Alliance - Days Of Operation: Tuesdays 2 - 4pm, Wednesdays 2-4pm, & Thursdays 10 am - 12 noon
Llano Food Pantry
Address: 1110 Berry Llano, TX 78643
This food pantry provides groceries amenities for the public.
The Lunch Bunch
Address: 405 W Sandstone Llano, TX 78643

This is a free meal served every Wednesday from 11:30am - 1pm. Open to all ages and all income levels. Location: Annex building of the Church of Christ. There are several people there to talk to and pray with, if anyone is interested.
First Baptist Church
Address: 1103 17th St, Brady, TX 76825

The Food Pantry distributes food to people in need on the second Friday morning of each month from 9:00-12:00. On food distribution mornings, ministry team members handle the paperwork, pray with the recipients individually, bag and box the food, and carry it to the recipients’ vehicle. In a typical month we serve over 100 families, with each family receiving around 30 lbs of food, plus an extra smaller box if there are children in the home.
Texas Health and Human Services
Address: 214 Lynn Gavit, Brady, TX 76825

HHS offers help with food, health care and cash assistance for Texans. Find out if you are eligible by applying through yourtexasbenefits.com. Whether it’s Medicaid, SNAP food benefits or Temporary Assistance for Needy Families cash assistance, HHS is helping Texas families get back on their feet.
Lometa Food Pantry
Address: 100 S. 3rd Street Lometa, Texas 76853
Helping our community and those in need. We are a partner agency with Central Texas Food Bank providing healthy foods to anyone who needs a hand up.
Lampasas Mission
Address: 910 E 4th Street Lampasas, TX 76550

The Lampasas Mission is a multi-service organization dedicated to the restoration and healing of individuals and families. In relationship with those in need, we provide food, clothing, and household items, as well as guidance with spiritual needs.
Mason Ministerial Alliance Food Bank - River of Life Church
Address:217 E College Ave, Mason, TX 76856

The people of the world are waiting for you to reach out in whatever capacity you can. Our passion is to extend the hope and blessing that Jesus Christ has given us to all people groups of the world. River of Life is committed to supporting churches and organizations that are reaching out to the desperate. Find out today where you can join us.
First UMC - McCamey
Address: 820 S. Burleson Ave. 79752

The United Methodist Men of the First UMC are supporting the community food pantry located at the First Baptist Church (FBC) in McCamey. Non-perishable donations can be brought to the church and placed in the large basket at the entrance between the sanctuary and the fellowship hall. Frozen items or other perishable items should be taken directly to the FBC. A large basket has been placed at the Lowes supermarket (next to the bags of ice) for donations from the community.
Locations 34 Miles Away

Nolan County Welfare Office - Food Pantry
Address: 100 E 3rd St. Sweetwater, TX 79556
Provides assistance with food. Offers a bag of non-perishable goods once per month. You must have a valid identification and they only take walk-ins.

Samaritan’s House Food Pantry
Address: 109 E Dale St. Winters, TX 79567
Provides assistance with food. Offers a box with perishable and non-perishable goods. Dog food is also offered, when available.
Locations 12 Miles Away
South Plains Food Bank
Address: 5605 M.L.K. Jr Blvd, Lubbock, TX 79404

The South Plains Food Bank, inc. is a humanitarian organization dedicated to serving West Texas by providing those who experience food insecurity with a helping hand. The mission of the Food Bank Operations Division is to provide food for area hungry while preserving human dignity and offering self-sufficiency opportunities and maintaining and growing the donor base for food and funds through partnerships at every level.

This is only a list of resources. The Multicultural Center does not have a direct partnership with the food pantries and/or banks on the list. We recommend students to use caution when providing personal information.
Please contact us atmulticultural@angelo.eduand we can assist you.
